Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension

value[x] 0..1IdentifierPre-admission identifier

value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptIndicates that the patient is being re-admitted

value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptCategory or kind of location after discharge

Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionEncounter_Admission
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.Encounter.admission` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `Encounter.admission` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `Encounter.admission` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`Encounter.admission` 0..1 `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `Encounter.admission` 0..1 `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `Encounter.hospitalization` 0..1 `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `Encounter.hospitalization` 0..1 `BackboneElement`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `Encounter.admission` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Encounter.hospitalization`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Details about the admission to a healthcare service
element.definition: Details about the stay during which a healthcare service is provided.This does not describe the event of admitting the patient, but rather any information that is relevant from the time of admittance until the time of discharge.
element.comment: An Encounter may cover more than just the inpatient stay. Contexts such as outpatients, community clinics, and aged care facilities are also included.The duration recorded in the period of this encounter covers the entire scope of this admission record.
